page.title: 11SS. Peter and Paul, Sywell.
page.content: The Parish Church of SS. Peter and Paul is the only place of worship in Sywell. It is a Church of England Church and belongs to the Diocese of Peterborough. It is situated in the old village and is bordered on one side by the village green and the old school, and on the other sides by farmland. It is built of local sandstone and is very picturesque. There are weekly Holy Communion services and Evensong on alternate Sundays. Holy Baptism and other Sacraments are arranged separately with the Rector. At Harvest time the Primary School traditionally take part in the Communion Service. Each Friday, during Lent, the Primary School also take a service. There are more funeral services than weddings. Sywell, meaning seven wells, was mentioned in the original Domesday Book.
